snippet: After 101 years, the Salvation Army leaves for a new outpost in Brooklyn. The Lower Manhattan building will turn into an upscale hotel and luxury condominiums.
abstract: Salvation Army’s last outpost on the Bowery closes after 101 years in operation, another piece of the street’s history giving way to a changing neighborhood in a changing New York City; for about as long as the Bowery has been known as a place for the down and out, the building has stood as a symbol of the Salvation Army’s brand of hope amidst the misery of skid row.
lead_paragraph: After 101 years, the Salvation Army leaves for a new outpost in Brooklyn. The Lower Manhattan building will turn into an upscale hotel and luxury condominiums.

headline.main: As Salvation Army Moves Out, Another Piece of Bowery History Is Lost
headline.print_headline: As Salvation Army Moves Out, Another Piece of Bowery History Is Lost
